page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Our area is situated to the north of Bristol with easy access to motorway and rail networks leading to all parts of the country.{ {Filton}was a part of{Horfield}when the original Domesday was compiled,the land being fairly unproductive.History tells us that both areas were lawless. Today both areas are largely residential with a mixture of private and council housing.To the east is{ {Harry Stoke}and{Stoke Gifford}.The former with its slag heaps shows evidence of coalmining in the past.The latter is nowadays well known for Parkway,an important train station,and is witnessing extensive housing estate growth.To the south east is the unspoilt village of{Frenchay},a conservation area of much charm with wooded parkland and splendid houses built in earlier times by merchants.
